info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 4 at 3:48PM CDT by NWS Duluth MN
info.description:
Severe thunderstorms are expected to affect the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness after 6 PM this evening with the severe threat decreasing after 10 PM this evening. The storms may produce damaging winds, large hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and heavy rainfall. International Falls had a 78 mph gust with one storm earlier. Heavy rainfall may lead to flash flooding.
Now is the time to prepare in case thunderstorms threaten. Campers should take extra precautions now in order to secure campsites and make a plan in case of severe weather. For strong winds, try to keep your tent away from large or decayed trees. For large hail, use your well-tied down canoe or tent for shelter. For lightning, sit on your personal floatation devices or sleeping pads and avoid putting your tent on top of exposed tree roots to minimize your risk. Monitor NOAA Weather Radio for updates and possible warnings.

parameter.value: SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS WILL AFFECT THE BOUNDARY WATERS CANOE AREA WILDERNESS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING

area.areaDesc: North St. Louis; Northern Cook/Northern Lake
